nycTheatreExcerpt: But above all, of course, the show works because of Jacobs-Jenkins's writing, which is probing without losing its humor and bracingly honest without being cruel.

bwwExcerpt: Purpose is a big swing, but that’s what it takes to get a big hit. Jacobs-Jenkins’s breakthrough play, An Octoroon, was a rejection of old theatrical conventions. This one takes a seat at the table, where—rising to the occasion—it makes speeches, makes trouble and makes excellent theater.
